message: I'm starting a python convore API project and, at least initially, will be using convoread as a library - because it is that good
just odd to have all the interaction stuff coming along with it
I actually opened an issue for this on the repo

also would be nice to remove some of the formatting from the synchronous messages and move that to the code that is doing the display, and leave the Convore class as something that just handles the API
I think you can : ) just fork it
sure they can cherry-pick commits, but just is messy
sure, but makes it harder to offer improvements upstream
I think offer pull request is easy enough :)
I'm talking of splitting the project into two. Each with their own repo. A bit much for a pull.
I dont think this is necessary - shell client is small and come with lib as sample project.
maybe github is a better place to continue this discussion. i've copied my comment into the issue #1 https://github.com/foobarbuzz/convoread/issues/#issue/1
@ptone my intention was that convoread.convore *is* the api module that not depends on the command line tool. what exactly is wrong with the current module? hard-wired console error handling?
